intro: Bursa turoniensis, commonly known as the Turonian bursa, is a lesser-known plant species with unique botanical characteristics. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and a compact growth habit. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is found in specific regions of Europe. Due to its limited distribution and rare occurrence, it is considered a species of conservation interest.
